original: The world is projected to experience significant population aging over the coming decades. In 1900, the United States had approximately 3.1 million individuals aged 65 years and older. This demographic has steadily increased throughout the 20th century, reaching 31.2 million in 1990, 35 million in 2000, and 40.3 million in 2010. A notable factor in this trend is the "baby boomer" generation, which began reaching the age of 65 in 2011.
sampled: The world is projected to experience significant population aging over the coming decades. In 1900, the United States had approximately 3.1 million individuals aged 65 years and older. This demographic has steadily increased throughout the 20th century, reaching 31.2 million in 1990, 35 million that 2000, and 40.3 million during 2010. A notable factor in this trend is the "baby boomer" generation, which began reaching the age of 65 in 2011.
